Package au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.column

Class UnsupportedRepresentation

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.column.ColumnRepresentation
au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.column.UnsupportedRepresentation
public class UnsupportedRepresentation extends ColumnRepresentation
Used when a collection does not have a representation that can be expressed within a Spark dataframe. This class will throw an error if any attempt is made to access its value or traverse its fields. It accepts a description of the unsupported representation to provide more context in the error message.
Author:
John Grimes

    • vectorize

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation vectorize(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Column> arrayExpression, @Nonnull UnaryOperator<Column> singularExpression)
      Description copied from class: ColumnRepresentation
      Create a new ColumnRepresentation by providing two functions: one that takes an array and one that takes a singular value. The array function is applied to the column if it is an array, and the singular function is applied to the column if it is not an array.
      Specified by:
      vectorize in class ColumnRepresentation
      Parameters:
      arrayExpression - The function to apply to the column if it is an array
      singularExpression - The function to apply to the column if it is not an array
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation representing the result of the function

    • traverse

      Description copied from class: ColumnRepresentation
      Returns a new ColumnRepresentation that represents the result of traversing to a nested field within the current representation. This method also takes the FHIR type of the field into account to return a more specific representation.
